ssGUI::​Extensions
namespace
ssGUI::​Extensions
ssGUI::​Extensions::​BoxShadow
public
ssGUI::​Extensions::​Extension
ssGUI::​Extensions::​BoxShadow

Creates a box shadow beneath the GUI Object. The box shadow follows the position and size of the GUI Object.  So if you set PositionOffset and size offset to zero, the box shadow will be completely behind the GUI Object.  You should also set the min size of the GUI Object to be larger than blur radius, otherwise the extension will draw the box shadow larger than the GUI Object.

Variables & Constructor
protected:
    ssGUI::GUIObject* Container;    //See <BindToObject>
    bool Enabled;                   //See <IsEnabled>

    glm::vec2 PositionOffset;       //See <GetPositionOffset>
    glm::vec2 SizeOffset;           //See <GetSizeOffset>
    float BlurRadius;               //See <GetBlurRadius>
    glm::u8vec4 ShadowColor;        //See <GetShadowColor>
BoxShadow::BoxShadow() :    Container(nullptr),
                            Enabled(true),
                            PositionOffset(0, 0),
                            SizeOffset(5, 5),
                            BlurRadius(10),
                            ShadowColor(0, 0, 0, 127)
{}
Functions

virtual void SetPositionOffset(
glm::vec2 offset
)

Sets the position offset of the box shadow from the GUI Object position

SetBlurRadius
virtual void SetBlurRadius(
float radius
)

Sets the blur radius of box shadow. Note that this extension don't actually "blur" anything, it is just using gradients.

GetBlurRadius
virtual float GetBlurRadius() const

Returns the blur radius of box shadow. Note that this extension don't actually "blur" anything, it is just using gradients.

glm::u8vec4 color
